titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to reduce the floor on the deduction for medical expenses.
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to reduce the floor on the deduction for medical expenses.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

bill.summary: This bill makes permanent the reduction in the adjusted gross income (AGI) threshold that must be exceeded before a taxpayer may claim a deduction amount for medical expenses. The reduction is from 10% to 7.5% of AGI and 5% in any taxable year beginnning in 2020 or 2021.
